Content: I think so yes.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: my repo's fix doesnt seem like a good way to go about it for multiple nodes.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the steps `commit`, `nonce` and `partialsig` where the data is swapped between all nodes, needs to make sure that all the data is in there before creating the next hash.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I did it by sending each lot of data in exact order and only generateing hash on the last node.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: not sure in real world thats practical...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It should just check to make sure all feilds are populated somehow.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: is that restriction for nonce only, or also partial sigs?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I can add a counter at the required steps and only do the combine after all are there

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I ended up adding it for all 3 of those steps, not 100% sure if it needs it for all, but I know 100% that it works when used for all.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: to generate nonce, you need all commits. Pretty sure to generate partialsig you need all nonce, and to generate the combined sig, you need all partial sig.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it doesnt check this currently and as such gives wrong outputs.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, I will add this

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: You need to really pay attention to what order things are done. One tip I will give you is that the 3 steps to trade data are all the same RPC call, so just use the absh history and change the single hash, along with the name of the cclib call.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: session, commit, commit, commit..., then nonce, nonce, nonce, ...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all nodes need all commits to be able to generate a nonce

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: need all nonces to be able to do a partial sig

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: need all partial sigs to be able to do a combined sig

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: think multisig in three stages. all participants need to do each stage until you can start the next stage

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the dilithium is much easier, as it is the normal keypair model
